samples.name: Overview
samples.description: The example is designed to enable most essential features such as templating, swimlane, toggling columns, tooltip, and more in JS Kanban board.

samples.name: Default Functionalities
samples.description: The example demonstrates the default functionalities of JS Kanban with very minimal essential settings such as data source, columns, and card details.

samples.name: Swimlane
samples.description: The example explains how to configure swimlane and its related settings (sorting order, drag-and-drop, and more) in JavaScript Kanban board.

samples.name: Workflow
samples.description: The example demonstrates a workflow feature that controls the flow of cards while drag-and-drop the cards between the columns.

samples.name: Stacked Header
samples.description: The example explains how to add a stacked header to group logically related columns above a column header in JS Kanban.

samples.name: Dialog Editing
samples.description: The example explains how to handle the CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) actions on the JS Kanban cards from the application end.

samples.name: Search and Filter Cards
samples.description: The example demo shows how to filter the cards and make searching when more number of cards on a JavaScript Kanban board that helps you to focus.

samples.name: Sorting Cards
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to sort the cards in the ascending or descending based on the data source order or indexing or custom field on the Kanban board.

samples.name: Virtual Scrolling
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to load a large number of cards in the JavaScript Kanban board with optimal load time using the virtual scrolling feature.

samples.name: Local Data
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to bind data to the JavaScript Kanban board from the array of JavaScript objects (JSON) or instances of Data Manager.

samples.name: Remote Data
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to load data source from remote seervice to the JavaScript Kanban board using data manager.

samples.name: Header Template
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to customize the column headers of the JS Kanban board with text, images, badges, and count using HTML templates.

samples.name: Swimlane Template
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to customize the swimlane headers of the JS Kanban board using HTML templates, which is applicable to all swimlane headers.

samples.name: Card Template
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to customize the JavaScript Kanban cards using templates, which is used to design beautiful cards with text, images, and more.

samples.name: Tooltip Template
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to enable and disable the tooltip messages on JavaScript Kanban cards, and customize using templates.

samples.name: Toggle Columns
samples.description: This sample demonstrates the toggle column of JS Kanban, which is helpful to expand and collapse the columns and can be collapsed on page load also.

samples.name: Show/Hide Columns
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to show or hide the columns of JavaScript Kanban board dynamically, which is achieved from code using the public methods.

samples.name: WIP Validation
samples.description: The Work-in-progress (WIP) validation demo demonstrates the minimum and maximum limit of card per column or swimlane in JavaScript Kanban board.

samples.name: API
samples.description: The example showcases the important APIs of JavaScript Kanban in the property panel, which are used to manipulate the Kanban board dynamically.

samples.name: Events
samples.description: The sample showcases the client-side events of JavaScript Kanban with event tracer, which is helpful to customize the Kanban board from application end.
